p: The number of new cases is calculated from the previous data and presented in Fig. 1c, d, respectively, for China and South Korea. In particular, these data show peaks which are marked with asterisks on Fig. 1c, d. As mentioned in the introduction, a peak-shaped number of new cases is a common feature of epidemic outbreaks. The onset of the peak corresponds approximatively to the start of the s phase discussed earlier [ 14].
